revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.5)
revision.text:
'''Rod Filbrandt''' is a Vancouver-based cartoonist, illustrator, and writer.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lynch |first=Brian |url=https://www.straight.com/article-330314/vancouver/rod-filbrandts-wombat-collected-comic-strip-gets-book-launch-railway-club |title=Rod Filbrandt's Wombat: The Collected Comic Strip gets a book launch at the Railway Club | Vancouver, Canada |publisher=Straight.com |date=2010-06-22 |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inkstuds.org/?p=221 |title=Rod Filbrandt |publisher=Inkstuds |date=2007-10-11 |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanmag.com/author/Rod_Filbrandt |title=Rod Filbrandt | Vancouver Magazine |publisher=Vanmag.com |date= |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref name="anvilpress1">{{cite web|url=http://www.anvilpress.com/authors/Rod-Filbrandt |title=Rod Filbrandt |publisher=Anvil Press |date= |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://drawn.ca/archive/rod-filbrandt/ |title=Rod Filbrandt Â« Drawn! The Illustration and Cartooning Blog |publisher=Drawn.ca |date=2007-06-19 |accessdate=2011-08-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120707182551/http://drawn.ca/archive/rod-filbrandt/ |archivedate=2012-07-07 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Adam Wilson |url=http://www.canadiancontent.ca/interviews/120103filbrandt.html |title=cancon: interviews: Rod Filbrandt |publisher=Canadiancontent.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://7deadlysinners.typepad.com/sinners/rod_filbrandt/ |title=The Seven Deadly Sinners: rod filbrandt |publisher=7deadlysinners.typepad.com |date= |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Filbrandt |first=Rod |url=https://www.straight.com/article-117440/calling-out-rod-filbrandt-for-calling-out-bruce-allen |title=Calling out Rod Filbrandt for calling out Bruce Allen | Vancouver, Canada |publisher=Straight.com |date=2007-11-08 |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref> He was one of the writers of the animated television series ''[[The Brothers Grunt]]''.
He produced a comic strip called "Dry Shave" that was published weekly in Vancouver's ''[[The Georgia Straight]]'' and in Toronto's [[Eye Weekly]]. He is the creator of two other strips, "Wombat" and "Tar Paper Town".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://canadianbookshelf.com/Contributors/F/Filbrandt |title=Rod Filbrandt: Books |publisher=Canadian Bookshelf |date= |accessdate=2011-08-23}}</ref>
He has also produced illustrations that have appeared in such magazines as ''[[Vancouver Magazine]]'', ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', the [[The_Village_Voice|Village Voice]], and ''[[Men's Health (magazine)|Men's Health]]''.<ref name="anvilpress1"/>
As a production designer he has worked on such animated series as "[[Ed, Edd n Eddy]]," "The Mr. Hell Show," and "[http://www.hubworld.com/littlest-pet-shop/shows/littlest-pet-shop-show Littlest Pet Shop]."
Filbrandt has two books published by Anvil Press, "Dry Shave" and "Wombat."
